Whether you’re a prospective undergraduate, graduate, or part-time student, you can explore programs across every field of study at Syracuse.

The combination of rigorous coursework, study abroad opportunities, research, and internships, will position you to achieve your goals. And once you’ve graduated, you’ll continue to benefit from networking events, career counseling, and the support of alumni around the world.
and see what makes Syracuse University special. Or you can

Whether you’re a first-year or transfer student, and no matter where you’re from, here you’ll find all the information to get you started on your journey. Your next step could be your biggest yet—we’re here to lend a hand.

As a graduate student, you’ll work toward breakthroughs alongside faculty who are among the world’s finest researchers and scholars, all while creating lifelong professional relationships and advancing your career.

We're grateful for your service and stand ready to assist you in making the transition from boots to books! Whether you're looking to take courses part-time, full-time, online, or need something with more flexibility—we’ll help you find your best path.
You can do this! Get the degree you want, on a timeline that works for you. Syracuse loves part-time learners and we show it—with flexible formats and a supportive staff to guide you along the way.
Syracuse University strives to meet the financial needs of admitted students, and offers a variety of funding options to help make college as affordable as possible.
The best way to know if Syracuse is the right fit for you is to visit our gorgeous campus in the heart of New York State.
We're here to help you with your college search.

We take a chance on people who dream big. If you're ready to craft your own academic experience, conduct innovative research, and cheer on the Orange, Syracuse University is the place for you. Begin your application today!

To study the law is to join the ranks of some of the best minds in history—leaders, idealists, inventors, entrepreneurs, dreamers, agents of change, heroes. This is the tradition you enter at Syracuse Law.
Summer @ Syracuse isn’t just about traditional classes. There are also programs, institutes, and workshops for a wide range of students with varied interests.

Get ready for the world at a place that feels like home

We take a chance on people who dream big. If you're ready to craft your own academic experience, conduct innovative research, and cheer on the Orange, Syracuse University is the place for you. Begin your application today!
Domestic first-year and transfer students and international first-year and transfer students should use the Common Application to apply.

Applications for graduate programs are accepted through an online application. Syracuse University’s individual schools and colleges may have additional application requirements, which will be detailed once you begin your application.

Apply to Syracuse using the online veterans application. Syracuse University ranks among the nation’s top schools for veterans and is committed to affordability, academic success, and a comfortable fit within the student body.

Apply for J.D. or LL.M. admission. Syracuse Law offers an outstanding legal education at an internationally recognized, top-tier research university. Known for our highly ranked trial advocacy program, we also lead in fields such as disability rights and national security law.

Apply for part-time study at Syracuse University. Whether you’re interested in applying to an undergraduate degree program or registering for just one course, we’re here to help you take the next step.

Applications for graduate programs are accepted through an online application. Syracuse University’s individual schools and colleges may have additional application requirements, which will be detailed once you begin your application.
All students will be required to submit:
Letters of recommendation (as required by the program you’re applying to)
Writing sample (if required by your program)
Official GRE scores (if required by your program)
Military transcripts (for currently serving or veteran)
for more information on what you’ll need to apply.
If you are a veteran or member of the military, please submit military transcripts with your application for evaluation of transfer credits. Transcripts may be obtained as follows:
Community College of the Air Force
Army, Coast Guard, Marine Corps, Navy –
Specialty Schools – Schools such as the
issue their own transcripts. If you attended any specialty schools, please request an official transcript directly from the school in addition to your CCAF or JST transcripts.
Your application and supporting materials should be submitted online. If you need to send any additional items, please mail to:
Note: If you are sending materials using a package delivery company (i.e. FedEx, UPS, DHL), please use this address:
The department or program you are applying to is your best source for information and the best way to check your application status.
For general questions, feel free to call 315.443.4492 or
the Help Desk or click on “Contact our Help Desk” within the application.

Application deadlines for most graduate programs are as follows. Please consult the
to learn the exact dates for degrees you are interested in.
We strongly recommend submitting your application materials early. Recommendations, transcripts, and test scores (where applicable) can often take several weeks to arrive.
Deadlines apply to all programs, unless otherwise noted.
College of Engineering and Computer Science*
College of Visual and Performing Arts
David B. Falk College of Sport and Human Dynamics
Martin J. Whitman School of Management
Maxwell School of Citizenship and Public Affairs
S.I. Newhouse School of Public Communications

*These dates pertain to Master's degree applicants; prospective Ph.D. students are encouraged to apply as early as possible, and by January 15 to ensure strongest consideration for admission and financial support.
